sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Granulator for wet granulation of pharmaceutical powders to improve flow properties, compressibility, and content uniformity.
sections.scope: Applicable to granulation activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the granulator is installed on a stable foundation in a clean area.
Verify that all electrical connections and interlocks are functioning properly.
Check that the mixing bowl, impeller blades, and chopper are clean and dry.
Power ON the granulator and perform empty run to check operation.
Weigh all powder ingredients accurately as per batch formula.
Load powder blend into the granulator bowl.
Set the impeller rotation speed to low initially.
Start the impeller to mix dry powders uniformly.
Mix dry powders for specified time to achieve uniform blend.
Prepare binder solution of appropriate concentration and volume.
Start the chopper at low to medium speed.
Begin adding binder solution slowly through spray or pour method.
Control the rate of binder addition to achieve proper wet massing.
Monitor the wet mass formation and endpoint visually.
Adjust impeller and chopper speeds as needed during granulation.
Continue mixing until uniform wet mass with desired consistency is achieved.
Check wet mass consistency by squeeze test or visual observation.
Stop the impeller and chopper once endpoint is reached.
Discharge wet mass immediately for drying or further processing.
Clean the granulator bowl, impeller, chopper, and lid thoroughly.
Inspect equipment for any product buildup or residue.
Document granulation parameters, binder volume, and observations in the batch record.
precautions: Do not overload the granulator beyond rated capacity.
Add binder solution gradually to avoid over-wetting.
Monitor wet mass consistency carefully to achieve optimal granule properties.
Avoid over-granulation which produces hard, dense granules.
Clean equipment promptly to prevent material hardening.
Ensure proper ventilation if using volatile solvents.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, mask, and protective clothing.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
Discharge wet mass promptly to prevent drying in the bowl.
Validate granulation endpoint for consistent product quality.
